FuncDef:
The ipv6 intelligent-convergence enable command configures IS-IS IPv6 intelligent convergence.
The undo ipv6 intelligent-convergence enable command disables IS-IS IPv6 intelligent convergence. The ipv6 intelligent-convergence enable command configures IS-IS IPv6 intelligent convergence. The undo ipv6 intelligent-convergence enable command disables IS-IS IPv6 intelligent convergence. By default, IS-IS IPv6 intelligent convergence is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ExtraInfo: In a scenario where a single route source fails, after the ipv6 intelligent-convergence enable command is run, IS-IS can perform fast convergence using a fast convergence algorithm, improving convergence performance.
